title: Riot can you at least talk about Lee?
body:
After yet another patch with no changes to him, but random sweeping nerfs to other junglers, I'm starting to think that you're just stubbornly ignoring every Lee thread and hoping it eventually goes away.  You know what will go away faster?  Players when they realize you encourage them to give feedback on a forum that you don't care about :(

Don't you want us to feel like you love us so we don't mind dumping 30 bucks on DJ Sona?  :P

replies.body:
Lee Sin nerfs are going to have to accomplish two things.

1.  Lee Sin is either going to have to drop out of competitive play or be a rare-ish pick in competitive play otherwise the anti-Lee Sin circlejerk isn't going to be satisfied and demand more nerfs.

2.  These nerfs can't make Lee Sin the worst champion in the game in solo queue in the process or the pro-Lee Sin circlejerk is going to pressure Riot into reverting the nerfs or buffing Lee Sin and we will be back where we started.  Considering his winrate currently is around 46% and just outside the lowest 15 champion winrates, there isn't a lot of room for him to fall.
Look around the forums, many people have said it much more eloquently and with more detail than I would.

Lee has been at  46.46% win rate for last month and below 50% in win rate a few months consistently already. 

More than half of the game Lee is picked, his team loses. 

Why does he need change? or are you proposing to buff him?
You really think the old global winrate proves anything?

http://na.op.gg/statistics/champion/

old? updated monthly = old?

and do you really think Lee sin is OP?  lmao

Checked your stats, you played Lee once in season 4. 0-8-5 Lost. OP
Yes because me and a bunch of random people sucking at him means he isn't a broken champ :P
Ya you and the majority or people that played him actually means he isn't broken and not even close to it
No, that generally just means he takes a while to learn, or just cant be played properly unless the players mechanics are good enough.  That has nothing to do with his kit's power when used properly.

Ya takes a while and how long has he been out? 

If his OP kit can't be used by the majority of the population, why bother nerfing him?

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/esports/aYUEYaY2-almost-everyone-wants-to-see-champion-diversity-in-lcs

Phreak mentions him here. It seems to accurately reflect Riot's stance. Not stating an opinion, just wanted to give you a tool to read for yourself.
